item.title: Remembering the Carousel Hotel and Casino: A Vintage Vegas Gem Lost to Time
item.description:
A Whirl of Fun: The Carousel’s Rise on Fremont Street

Before the mega-resorts and high-roller spectacle, downtown Las Vegas pulsated with a unique, playful energy. A vibrant piece of that history was the Carousel Hotel and Casino, a beloved Fremont Street fixture that operated from 1964 to 1974. Standing prominently on the corner of Fremont and 1st, it was a visual landmark, distinguishable by its bright neon marquee and, of course, its carousel-themed imagery. It wasnâ€™t about lavish luxury; it was about affordable fun and a genuinely welcoming atmosphere, a stark contrast to the increasingly upscale casinos sprouting along the Strip.
